text:
Hey <@U01K3VD3154> I've worked with numerous Fortune companies, and got into Airbnb with a cold application.

In my experience, networking has been invaluable for getting many of the logos on my site, but when it comes to the FTE roles, having a solid portfolio is what gets your foot in the door.

When speaking with the hiring manager and the team, it's best to address the qualities/needs of the role you're applying for and explain how your previous work prepared you for that position.

I also know from my own interviews and when I've been on interview panels, behavioral questions and hypotheticals about possible work situations (receiving feedback workflow, etc.) comes up a bit. Every team is different but I  know collaboration is top of mind.

elements.text:
I've worked with numerous Fortune companies, and got into Airbnb with a cold application.

In my experience, networking has been invaluable for getting many of the logos on my site, but when it comes to the FTE roles, having a solid portfolio is what gets your foot in the door.

When speaking with the hiring manager and the team, it's best to address the qualities/needs of the role you're applying for and explain how your previous work prepared you for that position.

I also know from my own interviews and when I've been on interview panels, behavioral questions and hypotheticals about possible work situations (receiving feedback workflow, etc.) comes up a bit. Every team is different but I  know collaboration is top of mind.
